div.p: Effective April 8, 2020: All school facilities, including fields, tracks, courts, playgrounds, etc., are closed. Thank you for your understanding and cooperation.

div.p: Click here for the District's current e-newsletter

div.h3: Not getting those snow calls? Emails arriving late?

div.p: Dear KLSD Families,

Now that we're in snow season, if you'd like to update your contact information for those early morning calls, texts, and emails (and for any other communications from the District), please follow this link.

Please know that we're aware of the lag time between the phone calls and the emails in the morning. We're working with the vendor to address it. In the meantime, if you're not already receiving our texts (which arrive very quickly), I encourage you to add your cell phone number through the same link above. In addition, all delay/closing information is added to our website as soon as the decision is made. It's also posted on Facebook and Twitter.
Additional information about our Campus Parent (formerly known as Parent Portal) software, can be found here, and on our technology department's website.
Thank you,
Andrew Selesnick, Superintendent of Schools
Due to the snow days on December 2 and December 17, the Weather Reserve Days scheduled for April 3 and April 13, will now be regular school days.

Effective Wednesday, August 14th, a new version of the Parent Portal, now referred to as Campus Parent, is available. Most of the functionality remains the same, but the layout and menus have changed. Please see the link below for documentation regarding the changes. If you have an existing Parent Portal account there is nothing that you need to do to use the new system. If you are a new family and need to create an account, you may do so using the activation key that was provided to you at registration. The new website is here: Campus Parent
All physicals should be documented on the New York State Form. (Doctors' offices have the form.)
Physicals are mandated for grades K, 1, 3, 5, 7, 9, 11, and all new entrants.
Physicals are required every year for athletes in grades 7 – 12.

div.p: April 17, 2020
Dear KLSD Community,

Yesterday, Governor Cuomo issued his latest executive order and all schools in New York State are now closed through at least May 15. We will continue providing distance learning for as long as we are closed. As the closure now approaches the end of this school year, we are giving a great deal of thought to all those end of year activities. We are mindful of the importance of various celebrations and will look for every avenue to maintain them in new ways. Please watch for opportunities to give your input and be involved.

Last night, more than 300 members of our community joined us for a Q & A via Zoom. My thanks to all who joined. To everyone else, you can now watch a recording of the session on our website. Your feedback and questions continue to be enormously helpful.

I wish everyone a safe, restful, and healthy weekend. Don't forget the Governor's rule about wearing a face covering in public places where social distancing is not possible. This new rule takes effect tonight.
Be well,
Andrew Selesnick, Superintendent of Schools
For additional information from the Superintendent's office, please click HERE.
